00072 /* memory allocation pools for arrays of pointers to Lpipe_LRInfo and 
00073    Lpipe_MVEInfo structures associated with the source and destination 
00074    registers of an oper.  The arrays are attached to Softpipe_Op_Info
00075    structures */
00076 
00077 L_Alloc_Pool *Lpipe_src_mve_pool = NULL;        /* for array of pointers to
00078                                                    Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
00079 L_Alloc_Pool *Lpipe_pred_mve_pool = NULL;       /* for array of pointers to
00080                                                    Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
00081 L_Alloc_Pool *Lpipe_dest_mve_pool = NULL;       /* for array of pointers to
00082                                                    Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
00083 
00084 /* memory allocation pools for the info structures themselves */
00085 
00086 static L_Alloc_Pool *Lpipe_LRInfo_pool = NULL;  /* Lpipe_LRInfo structs */
00087 L_Alloc_Pool *Lpipe_MVEInfo_pool = NULL;        /* Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
00088 
00089 static List Lpipe_mve_lr_list = NULL;   
00090 /* pointer to list of loop variants for the loop */

00093                 Live Range Function Definitions
00094 *************************************************************************/

00096 #if 1

00099 #define LPIPE_LR_TYPE (SM_REGISTER_TYPE)

00102 /* create and initialize a Lpipe_LRInfo structure */
00103 static Lpipe_LRInfo *
00104 Lpipe_create_live_range_info (SM_Reg_Info * rinfo)
00105 {
00106   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
00107 
00108   if (!Lpipe_LRInfo_pool)
00109     Lpipe_LRInfo_pool = 
00110       L_create_alloc_pool ("Lpipe_LRInfo", sizeof (Lpipe_LRInfo), 50);
00111 
00112   lr_info = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) L_alloc (Lpipe_LRInfo_pool);
00113 
00114   lr_info->rinfo = rinfo;
00115   lr_info->lifetime = 0;
00116   lr_info->def_sm_oper = NULL;
00117   lr_info->live_in_def_time = -1;
00118   lr_info->first_def_time = -1;
00119   lr_info->first_def_slot = -1;
00120   lr_info->last_access_slot = -1;
00121   lr_info->last_access_slot = -1;
00122   lr_info->use_after_def_slot = 0;
00123   lr_info->num_names = 0;
00124   lr_info->num_names_w_pro = 0;
00125   lr_info->names = NULL;
00126   lr_info->live_out = 0;
00127   lr_info->live_in = 0;
00128   lr_info->prologue_mov_inserted = 0;
00129 
00130   if (rinfo->first_def)
00131     {
00132       SM_Reg_Action *raction, *rraction = NULL;
00133       int rtime = 0, rslot = 0;
00134       Softpipe_Op_Info *sinfo;
00135 
00136       /* We must identify the first-scheduled definition---this is the
00137        * "reference" definition for this live range.
00138        */
00139 
00140       for (raction = rinfo->first_def; raction; raction = raction->next_def)
00141         {
00142           if (!raction->sm_op)
00143             continue;
00144 
00145           sinfo = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (raction->sm_op->lcode_op);
00146 
00147 #if 0
00148           if (sinfo->issue_time != raction->sm_op->sched_cycle + 
00149               raction->sm_op->sm_cb->sched_cycle_offset ||
00150               sinfo->issue_slot != raction->sm_op->sched_slot)
00151             fprintf (stderr, "SWP/SM MISMATCH (op %d) %d:%d != %d:%d\n", 
00152                      raction->sm_op->lcode_op->id,
00153                      sinfo->issue_time, sinfo->issue_slot, 
00154                      raction->sm_op->sched_cycle + 
00155                      raction->sm_op->sm_cb->sched_cycle_offset, 
00156                      raction->sm_op->sched_slot);
00157 #endif
00158 
00159           if (!rraction || 
00160               sinfo->issue_time < rtime ||
00161               (sinfo->issue_time == rtime && sinfo->issue_slot < rslot))
00162             {
00163               rraction = raction;
00164               rtime = sinfo->issue_time;
00165               rslot = sinfo->issue_slot;
00166             }
00167         }
00168     
00169       assert (rraction);
00170 
00171       /* first (reference) definition identified */
00172 
00173       lr_info->def_sm_oper = rraction->sm_op;
00174       lr_info->first_def_time = lr_info->last_access_time = rtime;
00175       lr_info->first_def_slot = lr_info->last_access_slot = rslot;
00176     }
00177 
00178   rinfo->ext = (void *)lr_info;
00179 
00180   return (lr_info);
00181 }

00183 
00184 static List
00185 Lpipe_delete_all_live_range_info (List lr_list)
00186 {
00187   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
00188 
00189   /* free Lpipe_LRInfo structures */
00190 
00191   List_start (lr_list);
00192   while ((lr_info = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) List_next (lr_list)))
00193     {
00194       if (lr_info->names)
00195         {
00196           int i;
00197           for (i = 0; i < lr_info->num_names_w_pro; i++)
00198             L_delete_operand (lr_info->names[i]);
00199           Lcode_free (lr_info->names);
00200           lr_info->names = NULL;
00201         }
00202       lr_info->num_names = 0;
00203       lr_info->num_names_w_pro = 0;
00204       L_free (Lpipe_LRInfo_pool, lr_info);
00205       lr_list = List_delete_current (lr_list);
00206     }
00207 
00208   List_reset (lr_list);
00209 
00210   return NULL;
00211 }

00214 /* find live range info structure for vreg if it exists */
00215 static Lpipe_LRInfo *
00216 Lpipe_find_live_range (List lr_list, SM_Reg_Info * rinfo)
00217 {
00218   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
00219 
00220   List_start (lr_list);
00221   while ((lr_info = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) List_next (lr_list)))
00222     {
00223       if (lr_info->rinfo == rinfo)
00224         return lr_info;
00225     }
00226 
00227   return NULL;
00228 }
00229 
00230 
00231 static void
00232 Lpipe_update_lr_last_acc (Lpipe_LRInfo * lr_info,
00233                           int issue_time, int issue_slot, int ii)
00234 {
00235   if (issue_time > lr_info->last_access_time)
00236     {
00237       lr_info->last_access_time = issue_time;
00238       lr_info->last_access_slot = issue_slot;
00239     }
00240   else if (issue_time == lr_info->last_access_time)
00241     {
00242       if (issue_slot > lr_info->last_access_slot)
00243         lr_info->last_access_slot = issue_slot;
00244     }
00245 
00246   /* Derived entries track changes */
00247 
00248   lr_info->lifetime = lr_info->last_access_time - lr_info->first_def_time;
00249   lr_info->use_after_def_slot = !(lr_info->lifetime % ii) &&
00250     (lr_info->last_access_slot > lr_info->first_def_slot);
00251 
00252   return;
00253 }
00254

00256 static Lpipe_MVEInfo *
00257 Lpipe_new_opd_mve_info (Lpipe_LRInfo * lr)
00258 {
00259   Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info;
00260 
00261   mve_info = (Lpipe_MVEInfo *) L_alloc (Lpipe_MVEInfo_pool);
00262 
00263   mve_info->lifetime = 0;
00264   mve_info->live_range = lr;
00265   mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr = 0;
00266   return mve_info;
00267 }

00269 
00270 static void
00271 Lpipe_print_live_ranges (List lr_list, int ii)
00272 {
00273   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr;
00274   int i;
00275 
00276   fprintf (stderr, "BEGIN LR LIST FROM MVE ANALYSIS (II = %d)\n", ii);
00277 
00278   if (List_size (lr_list))
00279     fprintf (stderr, "VREG   LT    RD  LIDEF      FDEF      "
00280              "LACC UD LI LO  NN NAMES\n");
00281 
00282   List_start (lr_list);
00283   while ((lr = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) List_next (lr_list)))
00284     {
00285       fprintf (stderr, "%4d %4d %5d %6d %6d/%2d %6d/%2d %2u %2u %2u %3d ",
00286                lr->rinfo->id, lr->lifetime, lr->def_sm_oper->lcode_op->id,
00287                lr->live_in_def_time, lr->first_def_time,
00288                lr->first_def_slot, lr->last_access_time, lr->last_access_slot,
00289                lr->use_after_def_slot, lr->live_in, lr->live_out,
00290                lr->num_names);
00291       if (!lr->names)
00292         {
00293           fprintf (stderr, "     X");
00294         }
00295       else
00296         {
00297           for (i = 0; i < lr->num_names; i++)
00298             fprintf (stderr, "%6d", lr->names[i]->value.r);
00299         }
00300 
00301       fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00302     }
00303 
00304   fprintf (stderr, "END LR LIST\n");
00305 
00306 }

00308 /*************************************************************************
00309                 MVE Service Function Definitions

00311 
00312 /* decrement count modulo unroll */
00313 static int
00314 Lpipe_modulo_decrement (int count, int unrolled)
00315 {
00316   if (count == 0)
00317     return (unrolled - 1);
00318   else
00319     return (count - 1);
00320 }

00322 
00323 static void
00324 Lpipe_print_mve_info (SM_Cb * sm_cb)
00325 {
00326   SM_Oper *sm_op;
00327   Softpipe_Op_Info *spinfo;
00328   Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info;
00329   L_Oper *oper;
00330   int i;
00331 
00332   fprintf (stderr, "BEGIN MVE INFO FROM MVE ANALYSIS\n");
00333 
00334   for (sm_op = sm_cb->first_serial_op; sm_op; sm_op = sm_op->next_serial_op)
00335     {
00336       oper = sm_op->lcode_op;
00337       spinfo = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00338 
00339       fprintf (stderr, "(OP %d ", oper->id);
00340       fprintf (stderr, "<");
00341       mve_info = spinfo->pred_mve_info[0];
00342       if (mve_info)
00343         fprintf (stderr, "(%d %d %d)", oper->pred[0]->value.r,
00344                  mve_info->lifetime, 
00345                  mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr);
00346       else
00347         fprintf (stderr, "()");
00348       fprintf (stderr, ">[ ");
00349       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00350         {
00351           mve_info = spinfo->dest_mve_info[i];
00352           if (mve_info)
00353             fprintf (stderr, "(%d %d %d)", oper->dest[i]->value.r,
00354                      mve_info->lifetime,
00355                      mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr);
00356           else
00357             fprintf (stderr, "()");
00358         }
00359       fprintf (stderr, "][ ");
00360       for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
00361         {
00362           mve_info = spinfo->src_mve_info[i];
00363           if (mve_info)
00364             fprintf (stderr, "(%d %d %d)", oper->src[i]->value.r,
00365                      mve_info->lifetime,
00366                      mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr);
00367           else
00368             fprintf (stderr, "()");
00369         }
00370       fprintf (stderr, "])\n");
00371     }
00372 
00373   fprintf (stderr, "END MVE INFO\n");
00374 
00375 }
00376 
00377 
00378 static void
00379 Lpipe_delete_all_mve_info (L_Oper * oper)
00380 {
00381   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00382   Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info;
00383   int i;
00384 
00385   for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
00386     if (softpipe_info->src_mve_info[i] != NULL)
00387       {
00388         L_free (Lpipe_MVEInfo_pool, softpipe_info->src_mve_info[i]);
00389         softpipe_info->src_mve_info[i] = NULL;
00390       }
00391   for (i = 0; i < L_max_pred_operand; i++)
00392     if (softpipe_info->pred_mve_info[i] != NULL)
00393       {
00394         L_free (Lpipe_MVEInfo_pool, softpipe_info->pred_mve_info[i]);
00395         softpipe_info->pred_mve_info[i] = NULL;
00396       }
00397   for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
00398     if (softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[i] != NULL)
00399       {
00400         L_free (Lpipe_MVEInfo_pool, softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[i]);
00401         softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[i] = NULL;
00402       }
00403 
00404   List_start (softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info);
00405   while ((mve_info = List_next (softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info)))
00406     L_free (Lpipe_MVEInfo_pool, mve_info);
00407   List_reset (softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info);
00408   softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info = NULL;
00409   return;
00410 }
00411 
00412 
00413 void
00414 Lpipe_free_mve_info ()
00415 {
00416   L_Oper *first_op;
00417   L_Oper *last_op;
00418   L_Oper *oper;
00419   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
00420 
00421   /* All copies of the kernel, and the prologue and epilogue point to
00422      the same Lpipe_MVEInfo, Lpipe_MVEInfo and  Lpipe_LRInfo structures 
00423      and arrays of pointers to them.  So, only need to free them for one 
00424      copy of the kernel */
00425 
00426   if (Lpipe_schema == REM_LOOP || Lpipe_schema == MULTI_EPI)
00427     {
00428       first_op = kernel_copy_first_op[0];
00429       last_op = kernel_copy_last_op[0];
00430     }
00431   else
00432     {
00433       first_op = header_cb->first_op;
00434       last_op = header_cb->last_op;
00435     }
00436 
00437   /* free Lpipe_MVEInfo, Lpipe_MVEInfo, and MVE-related arrays
00438      pointed to by Softpipe_Op_Info */
00439   for (oper = first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
00440     {
00441       if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00442         {
00443           /* will break out after last_op */
00444 
00445           if ((softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper)))
00446             {
00447               Lpipe_delete_all_mve_info (oper);
00448 
00449               L_free (Lpipe_src_mve_pool, softpipe_info->src_mve_info);
00450               softpipe_info->src_mve_info = 0;
00451               L_free (Lpipe_pred_mve_pool, softpipe_info->pred_mve_info);
00452               softpipe_info->pred_mve_info = 0;
00453               L_free (Lpipe_dest_mve_pool, softpipe_info->dest_mve_info);
00454               softpipe_info->dest_mve_info = 0;
00455             }
00456           if (oper == last_op)
00457             break;
00458         }
00459     }
00460 
00461   /* free Lpipe_LRInfo structures */
00462   Lpipe_mve_lr_list = Lpipe_delete_all_live_range_info (Lpipe_mve_lr_list);
00463 
00464   return;
00465 }
00466 
00467 
00468 /*************************************************************************
00469                 Associate Virtual Registers with Lifetimes
00470 *************************************************************************/
00471 
00472 /* 0 for Empty array, 1 for cannot share with any lr, 2 can share with prev lr */
00473 static int
00474 Lpipe_get_best_lr (List * op_array, Lpipe_LRInfo * prev_lr_info,
00475                    Lpipe_LRInfo ** lr_info, int ii)
00476 {
00477   int index;
00478   int end = (8 * ii);
00479   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr = NULL;
00480 
00481   if (prev_lr_info != NULL)
00482     index = (8 * (prev_lr_info->last_access_time % ii)) +
00483       prev_lr_info->last_access_slot + 1;
00484   else
00485     index = end;
00486 
00487   for (; index < end; index++)
00488     {
00489       if (List_size (op_array[index]) == 0)
00490         continue;
00491 
00492       List_start (op_array[index]);
00493       while ((lr = List_next (op_array[index])))
00494         {
00495           if (lr->rinfo->operand->ctype == prev_lr_info->rinfo->operand->ctype)
00496             {
00497               op_array[index] = List_remove (op_array[index], (void *) lr);
00498               *lr_info = lr;
00499               return 2;
00500             }
00501         }
00502     }
00503 
00504   /* None found. Select the first available. */
00505 
00506   for (index = 0; index < end; index++)
00507     {
00508       if (List_size (op_array[index]))
00509         {
00510           List_start (op_array[index]);
00511           lr = List_next (op_array[index]);
00512           op_array[index] = List_remove (op_array[index], (void *) lr);
00513           *lr_info = lr;
00514           return 1;
00515         }
00516     }
00517 
00518   /* All lrs used. */
00519 
00520   *lr_info = NULL;
00521   return 0;
00522 }
00523 
00524 
00525 /* return 1 on success; -1 on failure */
00526 static int
00527 Lpipe_associate_rot_regs (List lr_list, SM_Cb *sm_cb, int count_only)
00528 {
00529   /*
00530    * ROTATING REGISTERS
00531    * ------------------------------------------------------------
00532    */
00533 
00534   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
00535   L_Cb *cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb;
00536   int ii = sm_cb->II;
00537   int num_stages = sm_cb->stages;
00538   SM_Reg_Info *rinfo;
00539   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
00540   L_Attr *rr_attr;
00541   int int_reg_base, flt_reg_base, dbl_reg_base, pred_reg_base;
00542   int int_reg_num, flt_reg_num, dbl_reg_num, pred_reg_num;
00543   int int_reg_next = 0, flt_reg_next = 0, dbl_reg_next = 0, pred_reg_next = 0;
00544   int def_stage, use_stage, i, num_names = 0, available = 1;
00545 
00546   List *op_array = Lcode_calloc (ii * 8, sizeof (List));
00547 
00548   if (Lpipe_print_mve_summary)
00549     fprintf (stderr, "\nRotating register summary\n"
00550              "Register        PTYPE   Lifetime "
00551              "   use_after_def_slot    Number of Names\n");
00552 
00553   /* calculate the number of names needed for each variant */
00554 
00555   List_start (lr_list);
00556   while ((lr_info = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) List_next (lr_list)))
00557     {
00558       int def_time, use_time;
00559 
00560       rinfo = lr_info->rinfo;
00561 
00562       /* Find the earliest write, which may be a live in value. */
00563 
00564       if (lr_info->live_in &&
00565           (lr_info->live_in_def_time < lr_info->first_def_time))
00566         def_time = lr_info->live_in_def_time;
00567       else
00568         def_time = lr_info->first_def_time;
00569 
00570       use_time = lr_info->last_access_time;
00571 
00572       def_stage = def_time / ii;
00573       use_stage = use_time / ii;
00574 
00575       num_names = use_stage - def_stage + 1;
00576 
00577       /* registers that are defined once and never used in loop
00578          have lifetime and num_names equal to 0 */
00579       if (lr_info->lifetime == 0)
00580         num_names = 1;
00581 
00582       if (num_names <= 0)
00583         L_punt ("Lpipe_alloc_rot_regs: "
00584                 "num_names is not greater than zero");
00585 
00586       /* Special case: if the lifetime is less than or equal to the
00587          II, then we do not have to allocate a rotating register; it
00588          can be allocated to a standard register. */
00589 
00590       /* Don't do this for predicates, since on TAHOE there are many
00591          more rotating predicate registers than stationary ones.  This
00592          is a hack --- the register allocator should eventually deal
00593          correctly with this, and allocate single-stage predicates to
00594          available rotating registers.  */
00595 
00596       if (lr_info->lifetime <= ii && !lr_info->use_after_def_slot &&
00597           lr_info->rinfo->operand->ctype != L_CTYPE_PREDICATE)
00598         num_names = 0;
00599 
00600       if ((rinfo->type & SM_MACRO_TYPE) && (num_names > 1))
00601         L_punt ("Lpipe_alloc_rot_regs: " "cannot rename macro registers\n");
00602 
00603       lr_info->num_names = num_names;
00604 
00605       /* Insert live ranges into an array based on start time and slot number.
00606          When a live range ends, this array will be consulted to see if
00607          the ending register can be used to start a new live range. */
00608 
00609       if (num_names > 0)
00610         {
00611           int index;
00612 
00613           /* Find the earliest write, which may be a live in value. */
00614           if (lr_info->live_in &&
00615               lr_info->live_in_def_time <= lr_info->first_def_time)
00616             index = 0;
00617           else
00618             index =
00619               (8 * (lr_info->first_def_time % ii)) + lr_info->first_def_slot;
00620 
00621           if (index < 0 || index >= (ii * 8))
00622             L_punt ("Lpipe_associate_rot_regs: invalid op_array index (%d).",
00623                     index);
00624 
00625           op_array[index] =
00626             List_insert_last (op_array[index], (void *) lr_info);
00627         }
00628 
00629       if (Lpipe_print_mve_summary)
00630         {
00631           if (L_is_ctype_predicate_direct (lr_info->rinfo->operand->ctype))
00632             fprintf (stderr,
00633                      "%6d      %6d      %6d      %11d           %9d\n",
00634                      lr_info->rinfo->id, lr_info->rinfo->operand->ptype,
00635                      lr_info->lifetime, lr_info->use_after_def_slot,
00636                      lr_info->num_names);
00637           else
00638             fprintf (stderr,
00639                      "%6d      %6d      %6d      %11d           %9d\n",
00640                      lr_info->rinfo->id, L_PTYPE_NULL,
00641                      lr_info->lifetime, lr_info->use_after_def_slot,
00642                      lr_info->num_names);
00643         }
00644     }
00645 
00646 #if 0
00647   /* Dump the array of live range start points. */
00648   for (i = 0; i < (ii * 8); i++)
00649     {
00650       if (op_array[i] != NULL)
00651         {
00652           Lpipe_LRInfo *l;
00653 
00654           List_start (op_array[i]);
00655           while ((l = List_next (op_array[i])))
00656             {
00657               printf ("LR: id %d, index %d\n", l->rinfo->id, i);
00658             }
00659         }
00660     }
00661 #endif
00662 
00663   R_get_rot_regs (L_fn, &int_reg_base, &int_reg_num,
00664                   &flt_reg_base, &flt_reg_num,
00665                   &dbl_reg_base, &dbl_reg_num, &pred_reg_base, &pred_reg_num);
00666 
00667   int_reg_next = int_reg_base;
00668   flt_reg_next = flt_reg_base;
00669   dbl_reg_next = dbl_reg_base;
00670   pred_reg_next = pred_reg_base;
00671 
00672   /* Predicates for the stages of the kernel need predicates. 
00673      Use the assumption that the first stage_num predicates are the
00674      predicates for the stages.  */
00675 
00676   if (Lpipe_schema == KERNEL_ONLY)
00677     pred_reg_next += num_stages;
00678 
00679   if (count_only)
00680     {
00681       List_start (lr_list);
00682       while ((lr_info = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) List_next (lr_list)))
00683         {
00684           if (L_is_ctype_integer (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00685             int_reg_next += lr_info->num_names;
00686           else if (L_is_ctype_flt (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00687             L_punt ("Shouldn't encounter a float. MCM");
00688           else if (L_is_ctype_dbl (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00689             dbl_reg_next += lr_info->num_names;
00690           else if (L_is_ctype_predicate (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00691             pred_reg_next += lr_info->num_names;
00692           else
00693             L_punt ("Lpipe_alloc_rot_regs: invalid ctype");
00694         }
00695 
00696       /* Here we need to perform a check to see if the number
00697          of requested registers in each category is available. */
00698 
00699       if (M_arch == M_TAHOE)
00700         {
00701           if (int_reg_next >= (int_reg_base + 96))
00702             available = -1;
00703         }
00704       else
00705         {
00706           if (int_reg_next >=
00707               (int_reg_base +
00708                R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (M_native_int_register_ctype ())))
00709             available = -1;
00710         }
00711 
00712       if (dbl_reg_next >=
00713           (dbl_reg_base + R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE)))
00714         available = -1;
00715 
00716       if (pred_reg_next >=
00717           (pred_reg_base + R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE)))
00718         available = -1;
00719     }
00720   else                          /* !count_only */
00721     {
00722       int val;
00723       Lpipe_LRInfo *prev_lr_info = NULL;
00724 
00725       /* For each live range, assign it a set of registers.  The
00726          registers must be contiguous...a requirement that will make
00727          reading the code easier, but most of all, make register
00728          allocation later easier. */
00729 
00730       while ((val = Lpipe_get_best_lr (op_array, prev_lr_info, &lr_info, ii)))
00731         {
00732           if (val == 2)
00733             {
00734 #if 0
00735               printf ("Lpipe_associate_rot_regs: "
00736                       "Sharing one rr from prev_lr_info %d with lr_info %d.\n",
00737                       prev_lr_info->rinfo->id, lr_info->rinfo->id);
00738 #endif
00739             }
00740           else if (val == 1)
00741             {
00742 #if 0
00743               printf ("Lpipe_associate_rot_regs: "
00744                       "No sharing available for lr_info %d.\n",
00745                       lr_info->rinfo->id);
00746 #endif
00747             }
00748           else
00749             {
00750               L_punt ("MVE: How did we get here?");
00751             }
00752 
00753           prev_lr_info = lr_info;
00754 
00755           num_names = ++lr_info->num_names;
00756           lr_info->num_names_w_pro = num_stages + 2;
00757           lr_info->names =
00758             (L_Operand **) calloc (num_stages + 2, sizeof (L_Operand *));
00759           if (!lr_info->names)
00760             L_punt ("Lpipe_alloc_rot_regs: malloc out of space\n");
00761 
00762           /* First name is the original virtual register name.  This
00763              name will be used for the definitions in an imaginary
00764              iteration just before the first iteration of the loop.
00765              This corresponds to the name used outside the loop. */
00766 
00767           lr_info->names[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->rinfo->operand);
00768 
00769           for (i = 1; i < num_names; i++)
00770             {
00771               int rnum = 0;
00772 
00773               if (val == 2)
00774                 {
00775                   /* Recycling */
00776                   if (L_is_ctype_integer (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00777                     rnum = (int_reg_next - 1);
00778                   else if (L_is_ctype_flt (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00779                     rnum = (flt_reg_next - 1);
00780                   else if (L_is_ctype_dbl (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00781                     rnum = (dbl_reg_next - 1);
00782                   else if (L_is_ctype_predicate (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00783                     rnum = (pred_reg_next - 1);
00784                   else
00785                     L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: invalid ctype");
00786                 }
00787               else
00788                 {
00789                   /* Allocating new */
00790                   if (L_is_ctype_integer (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00791                     rnum = int_reg_next++;
00792                   else if (L_is_ctype_flt (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00793                     rnum = flt_reg_next++;
00794                   else if (L_is_ctype_dbl (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00795                     rnum = dbl_reg_next++;
00796                   else if (L_is_ctype_predicate (lr_info->rinfo->operand))
00797                     rnum = pred_reg_next++;
00798                   else
00799                     L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: invalid ctype");
00800                 }
00801 
00802               val = 0;
00803 
00804               lr_info->names[i] =
00805                 L_new_register_operand (rnum,
00806                                         lr_info->rinfo->operand->ctype,
00807                                         lr_info->rinfo->operand->ptype);
00808             }
00809         }
00810 
00811       /* Annotate the cb with the number of each type of register used. */
00812       rr_attr = L_new_attr ("rr", 4);
00813       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 0, int_reg_next - int_reg_base);
00814       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 1, flt_reg_next - flt_reg_base);
00815       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 2, dbl_reg_next - dbl_reg_base);
00816       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 3, pred_reg_next - pred_reg_base);
00817       cb->attr = L_concat_attr (cb->attr, rr_attr);
00818 
00819       /* Update the function attributes.  Record the maximum
00820          number of each type used. */
00821       
00822       if ((rr_attr = L_find_attr (fn->attr, "rr")))
00823         {
00824           if (int_reg_base != rr_attr->field[0]->value.i)
00825             L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: Incompatible int base rot regs.");
00826           if (flt_reg_base != rr_attr->field[2]->value.i)
00827             L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: Incompatible flt base rot regs.");
00828           if (dbl_reg_base != rr_attr->field[4]->value.i)
00829             L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: Incompatible dbl base rot regs.");
00830           if (pred_reg_base != rr_attr->field[6]->value.i)
00831             L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: Incompatible pred base rot regs.");
00832           if (int_reg_next - int_reg_base > rr_attr->field[1]->value.i)
00833             L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 1, int_reg_next - int_reg_base);
00834           if (flt_reg_next - flt_reg_base > rr_attr->field[3]->value.i)
00835             L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 3, flt_reg_next - flt_reg_base);
00836           if (dbl_reg_next - dbl_reg_base > rr_attr->field[5]->value.i)
00837             L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 5, dbl_reg_next - dbl_reg_base);
00838           if (pred_reg_next - pred_reg_base > rr_attr->field[7]->value.i)
00839             L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 7, pred_reg_next - pred_reg_base);
00840         }
00841       else
00842         {
00843           L_punt ("Unable to find rotating_registers attribute.");
00844         }
00845     }
00846 
00847   /* Destroy the array containing live range start information. */
00848   for (i = 0; i < (ii * 8); i++)
00849     op_array[i] = List_reset (op_array[i]);
00850 
00851   Lcode_free (op_array);
00852 
00853   return available;
00854 }
00855 
00856 
00857 static int
00858 Lpipe_associate_mve_regs (List lr_list, SM_Cb *sm_cb)
00859 {
00860   /*
00861    * MODULO VARIABLE EXPANSION
00862    * ------------------------------------------------------------
00863    */
00864   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
00865   int ii = sm_cb->II;
00866   SM_Reg_Info *rinfo;
00867   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
00868   int i, lifetime, num_names, unroll = 0;
00869 
00870   if (Lpipe_print_mve_summary)
00871     {
00872       fprintf (stderr, "\nMVE register summary\n");
00873       fprintf (stderr, "Register        PTYPE   Lifetime "
00874                "   use_after_def_slot    Number of Names\n");
00875     }
00876 
00877   /* calculate the required number of names for each variant
00878    * and the loop unrolls required for traditional mve renaming
00879    */
00880 
00881   List_start (lr_list);
00882   while ((lr_info = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) List_next (lr_list)))
00883     {
00884       rinfo = lr_info->rinfo;
00885 
00886       /* number of names is the ceiling of lifetime/II */
00887 
00888       lifetime = lr_info->lifetime;
00889       num_names = lifetime / ii;
00890 
00891       /* Registers defined once and never used in loop have lifetime
00892           and num_names equal to 0.  If definition and last use are
00893           scheduled in same cycle (mod ii) and lifetime != 0 and the
00894           use is in a later slot than the def, need an extra name. */
00895 
00896       if ((lifetime % ii) || (lifetime == 0) || lr_info->use_after_def_slot)
00897         num_names++;
00898 
00899       /* check to make sure macro registers don't need to be renamed */
00900       if (!(rinfo->type & SM_REGISTER_TYPE))
00901         {
00902           if (num_names > 1)
00903             L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: " "cannot rename macro registers\n");
00904           else
00905             continue;
00906         }
00907 
00908       lr_info->num_names = num_names;
00909 
00910       if (num_names > unroll)
00911         unroll = num_names;
00912 
00913       if (Lpipe_print_mve_summary)
00914         fprintf (stderr, "%6d      %6d      %6d      %11d           %9d\n",
00915                  lr_info->rinfo->id,
00916                  L_is_ctype_predicate_direct(lr_info->rinfo->operand->ctype) ? 
00917                  lr_info->rinfo->operand->ptype : L_PTYPE_NULL,
00918                  lr_info->lifetime, lr_info->use_after_def_slot,
00919                  lr_info->num_names);
00920     }
00921 
00922   /* Make the number of names for each variant a multiple of unroll and
00923      allocate operands to be used in renaming the variant. */
00924   List_start (lr_list);
00925   while ((lr_info = (Lpipe_LRInfo *) List_next (lr_list)))
00926     {
00927       rinfo = lr_info->rinfo;
00928 
00929       if (!(rinfo->type & SM_REGISTER_TYPE))
00930         continue;
00931 
00932       num_names = lr_info->num_names;
00933       while ((unroll % num_names) != 0)
00934         num_names++;
00935       lr_info->num_names = num_names;
00936       if (!(lr_info->names =
00937             (L_Operand **) calloc (num_names, sizeof (L_Operand *))))
00938         L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: malloc out of space\n");
00939 
00940       /* First name is the original virtual register name.  This
00941        * name will be used for the definitions in an imaginary
00942        * iteration just before the first iteration of the loop.
00943        * This corresponds to the name used outside the loop. 
00944        */
00945 
00946       lr_info->names[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->rinfo->operand);
00947 
00948       for (i = 1; i < num_names; i++)
00949         lr_info->names[i] = 
00950           L_new_register_operand (++fn->max_reg_id,
00951                                   lr_info->rinfo->operand->ctype,
00952                                   lr_info->rinfo->operand->ptype);
00953     }
00954 
00955   return unroll;
00956 }
00957 
00958 
00959 static List
00960 Lpipe_construct_lr (SM_Cb *kernel_cb)
00961 {
00962   L_Func *fn = kernel_cb->lcode_fn;
00963   int ii = kernel_cb->II;
00964   List lr_list = NULL;
00965   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
00966   Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info, **mve_ptr;
00967   SM_Oper *src_oper, *sink_oper;
00968   SM_Reg_Action *dest_operand;
00969   SM_Reg_Info *dest_operand_rinfo, *rinfo;
00970   SM_Dep *dep;
00971   Softpipe_Op_Info *src_softpipe_info, *sink_softpipe_info;
00972   int src_issue_time, sink_issue_time, issue_time, use_lifetime;
00973   int use_mod_ii, def_mod_ii;   /* definition and use time modulo II */
00974 
00975   for (rinfo = kernel_cb->first_rinfo; rinfo; rinfo = rinfo->next_rinfo)
00976     {
00977       if (!(rinfo->type & LPIPE_LR_TYPE))
00978         continue;
00979 
00980       if (!rinfo->first_def)
00981         continue;
00982 
00983       lr_info = Lpipe_create_live_range_info (rinfo);
00984       lr_list = List_insert_last (lr_list, lr_info);
00985     }
00986 
00987   /* Flow dependences represent the definitions of all loop
00988    * variants.  Output dependences indicate that multiple
00989    * definitions of the variant exist in the loop body.  For each
00990    * operation, two passes are made through the dependence info, the
00991    * first looking for flow dependences, the second for output
00992    * dependences.  Also build a list of branches for use in the
00993    * second pass.  
00994    */
00995 
00996   /* These routines create a list of live range functions and create
00997      mve_info structures for operands.  The arrays that hold the
00998      mve_info structures are created prior to this function. */
00999 
01000   for (src_oper = kernel_cb->first_serial_op; src_oper;
01001        src_oper = src_oper->next_serial_op)
01002     {
01003       int dest_number;          /* src_oper->dest[dest_number] 
01004                                    is source of dep */
01005       int src_number = 0;       /* sink_oper->src[src_number] 
01006                                    is sink of dep    */
01007 
01008       int def_cycle_diff = -1;
01009 
01010       src_softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (src_oper->lcode_op);
01011 
01012       if (L_START_STOP_NODE (src_oper->lcode_op))
01013         continue;
01014 
01015       /* First, go through all the destinations and set up Lpipe_LRInfo
01016          structures if needed. */
01017       for (dest_number = 0; dest_number < L_max_dest_operand; dest_number++)
01018         {
01019           if (!(dest_operand = src_oper->dest[dest_number]))
01020             continue;
01021 
01022           dest_operand_rinfo = dest_operand->rinfo;
01023 
01024           if (!(dest_operand_rinfo->type & LPIPE_LR_TYPE))
01025             continue;
01026 
01027           /* Check list of live ranges to see if live range
01028              structure already exists for this variant. */
01029 
01030           lr_info = Lpipe_find_live_range (lr_list, dest_operand_rinfo);
01031 
01032           assert (lr_info);
01033 
01034           src_softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[dest_number] = mve_info =
01035             Lpipe_new_opd_mve_info (lr_info);
01036 
01037           if (!lr_info->def_sm_oper)
01038             {
01039               /* Need to create live range structure. This is the reference
01040                  definition. */
01041               lr_info->def_sm_oper = src_oper;
01042               lr_info->first_def_time = src_softpipe_info->issue_time;
01043               lr_info->first_def_slot = src_softpipe_info->issue_slot;
01044               lr_info->last_access_time = src_softpipe_info->issue_time;
01045               lr_info->last_access_slot = src_softpipe_info->issue_slot;
01046             }
01047           else
01048             {
01049               /* Determine relationship between this definition and
01050                * the reference definition. If no cross-iteration
01051                * output dependence exists between the two
01052                * definitions, then the relationship is determined
01053                * simply by the issue times. If there is a cross-
01054                * iteration output dependence, then that must be
01055                * taken into account.  
01056                */
01057 
01058               int output_dep_found = 0;
01059 
01060               /* first check output dependences from reference oper
01061                  to oper */
01062               /* MCM Check the in dependences to this destination
01063                  register to see if they come from the definition
01064                  instruction. */
01065 
01066               for (dep = dest_operand->first_dep_in; dep;
01067                    dep = dep->next_dep_in)
01068                 {
01069                   if ((dep->flags & (SM_REG_DEP | SM_OUTPUT_DEP)) !=
01070                       (SM_REG_DEP | SM_OUTPUT_DEP))
01071                     continue;
01072                   if (dep->ignore)
01073                     continue;
01074                   if (dep->omega == 0)
01075                     continue;
01076                   if (dep->from_action->sm_op != lr_info->def_sm_oper)
01077                     continue;
01078 
01079                   /* Ensure that the flow is from a dest to a dest,
01080                      not a control dep. */
01081                   if (dep->from_action->operand_type != MDES_DEST ||
01082                       dep->to_action->operand_type != MDES_DEST)
01083                     continue;
01084 
01085                   output_dep_found = 1;
01086 
01087                   def_cycle_diff = src_softpipe_info->issue_time -
01088                     lr_info->first_def_time + ii * dep->omega;
01089 
01090                   issue_time = src_softpipe_info->issue_time + ii * dep->omega;
01091 
01092                   Lpipe_update_lr_last_acc (lr_info, issue_time,
01093                                             src_softpipe_info->issue_slot, ii);
01094                   break;
01095                 }
01096 
01097               if (!output_dep_found)
01098                 {
01099                   /* If no cross-iteration output dependence found
01100                      so far, check output dependences from oper to
01101                      reference oper. */
01102 
01103                   for (dep = dest_operand->first_dep_out; dep;
01104                        dep = dep->next_dep_out)
01105                     {
01106                       if ((dep->flags & (SM_REG_DEP | SM_OUTPUT_DEP)) !=
01107                           (SM_REG_DEP | SM_OUTPUT_DEP))
01108                         continue;
01109                       if (dep->ignore)
01110                         continue;
01111                       if (dep->omega == 0)
01112                         continue;
01113                       if (dep->to_action->sm_op != lr_info->def_sm_oper)
01114                         continue;
01115 
01116                       /* Ensure that the flow is from a dest to a
01117                          dest, not a control dep. */
01118                       if (dep->from_action->operand_type != MDES_DEST ||
01119                           dep->to_action->operand_type != MDES_DEST)
01120                         continue;
01121 
01122                       output_dep_found = 1;
01123 
01124                       /* Find number of cycles from reference definition 
01125                          to this definition. This number will be 0 or
01126                          negative because output dependence goes from
01127                          this definition to reference definition. */
01128 
01129                       def_cycle_diff = src_softpipe_info->issue_time -
01130                         lr_info->first_def_time - ii * dep->omega;
01131 
01132                       issue_time = src_softpipe_info->issue_time - 
01133                         ii * dep->omega;
01134 
01135                       if (issue_time < lr_info->first_def_time ||
01136                           (issue_time == lr_info->first_def_time && 
01137                            src_softpipe_info->issue_slot < lr_info->first_def_slot))
01138                         L_punt ("Definition issue time assumptions violated.");
01139                       break;
01140                     }
01141 
01142                   if (!output_dep_found)
01143                     {
01144                       /* The two definitions are from the same
01145                          iteration.  Find number of cycles from this
01146                          definition to reference definition in this
01147                          iteration.  This number may be positive or
01148                          negative depending on order of 2
01149                          definitions in same iteration. */
01150                       def_cycle_diff = src_softpipe_info->issue_time -
01151                         lr_info->first_def_time;
01152 
01153                       Lpipe_update_lr_last_acc (lr_info,
01154                                                 src_softpipe_info->
01155                                                 issue_time,
01156                                                 src_softpipe_info->
01157                                                 issue_slot, ii);
01158                     }
01159                 }
01160 
01161               /* record destination-operand-related information */
01162 
01163               /* Lifetime from the reference definition to this
01164                  definition of the variant.  May be negative. */
01165               mve_info->lifetime = def_cycle_diff;
01166 
01167               def_mod_ii = src_softpipe_info->issue_time % ii;
01168 
01169               if (def_cycle_diff >= 0)
01170                 mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr =
01171                   (def_mod_ii < (lr_info->first_def_time % ii));
01172               else
01173                 mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr =
01174                   (def_mod_ii > (lr_info->first_def_time % ii));
01175             }
01176         }
01177 
01178       /* Then check the flow dependences */
01179       for (dest_number = 0; dest_number < L_max_dest_operand; dest_number++)
01180         {
01181           int explicit_sink;
01182 
01183           if (!(dest_operand = src_oper->dest[dest_number]))
01184             continue;
01185 
01186           dest_operand_rinfo = dest_operand->rinfo;
01187 
01188           if (!(dest_operand_rinfo->type & LPIPE_LR_TYPE))
01189             continue;
01190 
01191           for (dep = dest_operand->first_dep_out; dep; dep = dep->next_dep_out)
01192             {
01193               if ((dep->flags & (SM_REG_DEP | SM_FLOW_DEP)) !=
01194                   (SM_REG_DEP | SM_FLOW_DEP))
01195                 continue;
01196 
01197               if (dep->from_action->operand_type != MDES_DEST)
01198                 continue;
01199 
01200               if (dep->to_action->operand_type != MDES_PRED &&
01201                   dep->to_action->operand_type != MDES_SRC &&
01202                   dep->to_action->operand_type != MDES_SYNC_IN)
01203                 continue;
01204 
01205               explicit_sink = dep->to_action->operand_type != MDES_SYNC_IN;
01206 
01207               /* find destination and source operands involved in
01208                  dependence */
01209               sink_oper = dep->to_action->sm_op;
01210               sink_softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (sink_oper->lcode_op);
01211 
01212               if (!explicit_sink)
01213                 {
01214                   L_Operand *dep_operand;
01215                   dep_operand = dep->from_action->rinfo->operand;
01216 
01217                   if (sink_softpipe_info->loop_back_br)
01218                     {
01219                       L_Oper *removed_oper = NULL;
01220                       int c = 0;
01221 
01222                       if (sink_oper->next_serial_op &&
01223                           L_START_STOP_NODE (sink_oper->next_serial_op->
01224                                              lcode_op))
01225                         {
01226                           removed_oper = sink_oper->next_serial_op->lcode_op;
01227                           L_remove_oper (kernel_cb->lcode_cb, removed_oper);
01228                         }
01229 
01230                       if (!L_in_oper_OUT_set (kernel_cb->lcode_cb,
01231                                               sink_oper->lcode_op,
01232                                               dep_operand, FALL_THRU_PATH))
01233                         c = 1;
01234 
01235                       if (removed_oper)
01236                         {
01237                           L_insert_oper_after (kernel_cb->lcode_cb,
01238                                                sink_oper->lcode_op,
01239                                                removed_oper);
01240                         }
01241 
01242                       if (c)
01243                         continue;
01244                     }
01245                   else
01246                     {
01247                       if (!L_in_oper_OUT_set (kernel_cb->lcode_cb,
01248                                               sink_oper->lcode_op,
01249                                               dep_operand, TAKEN_PATH))
01250                         continue;
01251                     }
01252                 }
01253 
01254               dest_number = dep->from_action->operand_number;
01255 
01256               if (!(lr_info = Lpipe_find_live_range (lr_list,
01257                                                      dest_operand_rinfo)))
01258                 L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: Could not find live range"
01259                         " structure for oper %d, "
01260                         "destination number %d\n",
01261                         src_oper->lcode_op->id, dest_number);
01262 
01263               mve_info = src_softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[dest_number];
01264 
01265               src_issue_time = src_softpipe_info->issue_time;
01266               sink_issue_time = sink_softpipe_info->issue_time;
01267 
01268               /* Compute lifetime from reference def to this use */
01269 
01270               use_lifetime = sink_issue_time - src_issue_time +
01271                 mve_info->lifetime + ii * dep->omega;
01272 
01273               /* If using the rotating registers, and this is live
01274                  out of the loopback branch, then increase then set
01275                  the last use as the first instruction after the
01276                  loopback branch, which will eventually model the
01277                  additional rotation that occurs when the loopback
01278                  fails. MCM Currently, there is no extra rotation on
01279                  side exit branches. */
01280 
01281               if (!explicit_sink && sink_softpipe_info->loop_back_br &&
01282                   (Lpipe_schema == MULTI_EPI_ROT_REG || 
01283                    Lpipe_schema == KERNEL_ONLY))
01284                 use_lifetime++;
01285 
01286               issue_time = lr_info->first_def_time + use_lifetime;
01287 
01288               Lpipe_update_lr_last_acc (lr_info, issue_time,
01289                                         sink_softpipe_info->issue_slot, ii);
01290 
01291               /* Check for live in.  Exclude registers that are not
01292                * live into the cb. 
01293                */
01294               if (L_in_cb_IN_set (kernel_cb->lcode_cb,
01295                                   dep->from_action->rinfo->operand))
01296                 {
01297                   int found = 0, temp_live_in_def_time, num_uses;
01298                   Set uses;
01299 
01300                   /* Look at the reaching defs of this op in the original
01301                      code to see if any defs reach into the loop. 
01302                      MCM There has got to be a better way to go this!!! */
01303 
01304                   uses = L_get_oper_RIN_defining_opers (sink_oper->lcode_op,
01305                                                         dep->from_action->
01306                                                         rinfo->operand);
01307                   num_uses = Set_size (uses);
01308                   if (num_uses > 0)
01309                     {
01310                       int u, *buffer = 
01311                         (int *) Lcode_malloc (sizeof (int) * num_uses);
01312                       L_Cb *cb;
01313                       Set_2array (uses, buffer);
01314                       uses = Set_dispose (uses);
01315                       for (u = 0; u < num_uses; u++)
01316                         {
01317                           cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl,
01318                                                         buffer[u]);
01319                           if (cb->id != kernel_cb->lcode_cb->id)
01320                             found = 1;
01321                         }
01322                       Lcode_free (buffer);
01323                     }
01324 
01325                   /* If only defs from within the kernel cb are found,
01326                      then register is not live in. */
01327                   if (found)
01328                     {
01329                       if (Lpipe_debug >= 2)
01330                         {
01331                           printf ("Live in oper %d on src %d\n",
01332                                   src_oper->lcode_op->id, src_number);
01333                           fflush (stdout);
01334                         }
01335 
01336                       lr_info->live_in = 1;
01337 
01338                       /* This use is mve_info->live_range->lifetime
01339                          from the def in real cycles.  However, this
01340                          use may also be a live in variable defined at
01341                          cycle 0 relative to the use. Cycle 0 is
01342                          (stage*II + cycle_within_stage) from this
01343                          use, which is stored as
01344                          src_softpipe_info->issue_time. Therefore,
01345                          relating that back to the reference def, the
01346                          live_in is
01347                          src_softpipe_info->issue_time-use_lifetime
01348                          cycles before the ref def. */
01349 
01350                       temp_live_in_def_time = lr_info->first_def_time
01351                         + use_lifetime - sink_issue_time;
01352 
01353                       if (temp_live_in_def_time != lr_info->live_in_def_time
01354                           && lr_info->live_in_def_time != -1)
01355                         L_warn ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: "
01356                                 "Refusing to change: " 
01357                                 "original live_in_def_time %d, "
01358                                 "new live_in_def_time %d.\n",
01359                                 lr_info->live_in_def_time,
01360                                 temp_live_in_def_time);
01361                       else
01362                         lr_info->live_in_def_time = temp_live_in_def_time;
01363                     }
01364                 }
01365 
01366               if (explicit_sink)
01367                 {
01368                   src_number = dep->to_action->operand_number;
01369 
01370                   /* record source-operand-related information for data or
01371                      predicate register */
01372                   if (dep->to_action->flags &
01373                       (SM_PRED_UNCOND_USE | SM_PRED_COND_USE))
01374                     mve_ptr = &(sink_softpipe_info->pred_mve_info[src_number]);
01375                   else
01376                     mve_ptr = &(sink_softpipe_info->src_mve_info[src_number]);
01377 
01378                   if (*mve_ptr)
01379                     continue;
01380 
01381                   *mve_ptr = mve_info = Lpipe_new_opd_mve_info (lr_info);
01382                 }
01383               else
01384                 {
01385                   lr_info->live_out = 1;
01386 
01387                   List_start (sink_softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info);
01388                   while ((mve_info = 
01389                           List_next (sink_softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info)))
01390                     if (mve_info->live_range == lr_info)
01391                       break;
01392 
01393                   if (mve_info)
01394                     continue;
01395 
01396                   mve_info = Lpipe_new_opd_mve_info (lr_info);
01397                   sink_softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info =
01398                     List_insert_last (sink_softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info,
01399                                       mve_info);
01400                 }
01401 
01402               use_mod_ii = sink_softpipe_info->issue_time % ii;
01403               def_mod_ii = lr_info->first_def_time % ii;
01404 
01405               mve_info->lifetime = use_lifetime;
01406 
01407               mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr = (use_lifetime >= 0) ?
01408                 (use_mod_ii < def_mod_ii) : (use_mod_ii > def_mod_ii);
01409             }
01410         }
01411     }
01412   return lr_list;
01413 }
01414 
01415 
01416 /*************************************************************************
01417                 MVE Analysis Function Definitions
01418 *************************************************************************/
01419 
01420 /* Note that this analysis appears to be similar to the live range
01421    analysis done by the register allocator.  However, it is more than
01422    that.  Traditional live range analysis simply computes the set of
01423    instructions over which a variable is live.  This routine computes
01424    the length of each live range from the first definition to each use
01425    and and live out.  An understanding of the output dependences and
01426    cross-iteration dependences is necessary to compute these lengths.
01427    Therefore this routine analyzes the flow and output dependences to
01428    compute the lifetime lengths rather than live range sets. */
01429 /* Analyze the loop variants to determine the amount of unrolling
01430    required for modulo variable expansion.  Build the data structures
01431    needed to rename loop variants after unrolling.  Returns the 
01432    required amount for unrolling. In count_only mode, a 
01433    1 is returned indicating the number of reqested rotating registers
01434    is available, while a -1 indicates they are unavailable.  */
01435 int
01436 Lpipe_analyze_lr (SM_Cb *kernel_cb, int count_only)
01437 {
01438   int unroll, ii = kernel_cb->II;
01439   List lr_list;
01440 
01441   /*
01442    * PHASE I
01443    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01444    * DEPENDENCE ANALYSIS
01445    */
01446 
01447   lr_list = Lpipe_construct_lr (kernel_cb);
01448 
01449   /*
01450    * PHASE II
01451    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01452    * SETUP FOR MVE OR ROTATING REGISTER GENERATION
01453    */
01454 
01455   if (Lpipe_schema == REM_LOOP || Lpipe_schema == MULTI_EPI)
01456     unroll = Lpipe_associate_mve_regs (lr_list, kernel_cb);
01457   else
01458     unroll = Lpipe_associate_rot_regs (lr_list, kernel_cb, count_only);
01459 
01460   if (count_only || (unroll == -1))
01461     {
01462       L_Oper *op;
01463 
01464       /* free mve info structures */
01465       for (op = kernel_cb->lcode_cb->first_op; op; op = op->next_op)
01466         if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (op))
01467           Lpipe_delete_all_mve_info (op);
01468 
01469       /* free Lpipe_LRInfo structures */
01470       lr_list = Lpipe_delete_all_live_range_info (lr_list);
01471     }
01472   else
01473     {
01474       if (Lpipe_mve_lr_list)
01475         L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_analyze: lr list is not empty");
01476 
01477       Lpipe_mve_lr_list = lr_list;
01478 
01479       if (Lpipe_debug >= 1)
01480         {
01481           Lpipe_print_live_ranges (lr_list, ii);
01482           Lpipe_print_mve_info (kernel_cb);
01483         }
01484     }
01485 
01486   return (unroll);
01487 }
01488 
01489 
01490 /*************************************************************************
01491                 Rotating Register Function Definitions
01492 *************************************************************************/
01493 
01494 int
01495 Lpipe_find_name (SM_Cb *sm_cb, Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info, Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info)
01496 {
01497   int src_stg, snk_stg, name_index;
01498 
01499   /* Find earliest write, which may be a live in value. */
01500 
01501   if (lr_info->live_in &&
01502       lr_info->live_in_def_time < lr_info->first_def_time)
01503     src_stg = lr_info->live_in_def_time / sm_cb->II;
01504   else
01505     src_stg = lr_info->first_def_time / sm_cb->II;
01506 
01507   snk_stg = (lr_info->first_def_time + mve_info->lifetime) / sm_cb->II;
01508 
01509   name_index = snk_stg - src_stg + 1;
01510 
01511   if (name_index < 1 || name_index >= lr_info->num_names)
01512     L_punt ("Lpipe_find_name: name %d is out of range.", name_index);
01513 
01514   return name_index;
01515 }
01516 
01517 
01518 static int
01519 Lpipe_mov_opc (L_Operand *opd)
01520 {
01521   int opc = 0;
01522 
01523   if (L_is_ctype_integer (opd))
01524     opc = Lop_MOV;
01525   else if (L_is_ctype_flt (opd))
01526     opc = Lop_MOV_F;
01527   else if (L_is_ctype_dbl (opd))
01528     opc = Lop_MOV_F2;
01529   else if (L_is_ctype_predicate (opd))
01530     opc = Lop_PRED_COPY;
01531   else
01532     L_punt ("Lpipe_mov_opc: Invalid operand ctype.");
01533 
01534   return opc;
01535 }
01536 
01537 
01538 /* Return the number of rotating registers required */
01539 int
01540 Lpipe_rreg_transform (SM_Cb * sm_cb)
01541 {
01542   L_Cb *kernel_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb;
01543   L_Oper *oper;
01544 
01545   if (!kernel_cb->first_op)
01546     L_punt ("Lpipe_rreg_transform: Empty kernel.  cb %d", kernel_cb->id);
01547 
01548   /* Using MVE, the registers are renamed for each of the iterations.
01549      Then, assuming that the loopback branch is in the last stage, 
01550      stages 1 through n are copied and used as the prologue.  Instructions
01551      with invalid stage identifiers for that stage of the prologue
01552      are eliminated.  Then, the incoming registers are copied into their
01553      MVE copy 1 registers. 
01554 
01555      Using rotating registers, there is only one copy of the kernel.
01556      We need MVE-like register renames for the prologue still. So,
01557      maybe generate the unrolled kernel, like normal to be used
01558      when generating the kernel.  But, the interface registers between
01559      the prologue and the kernel need to be generated.  
01560    */
01561 
01562   for (oper = kernel_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
01563     {
01564       Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
01565       Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info;
01566       Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
01567       int j, name_index;
01568       ITuint8 ptype;
01569 
01570       /* rename destination operands */
01571       for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
01572         {
01573           if (!L_is_register (oper->dest[j]))
01574             continue;
01575 
01576           if (!(mve_info = softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j]))
01577             L_punt ("Lpipe_rreg_transform: destination (op %d) "
01578                     "does not have a dest_mve_info", oper->id);
01579 
01580           lr_info = mve_info->live_range;
01581 
01582           /* If set to 1, then no rotating regs were allocated
01583              for this variable and it can be allocated to a 
01584              non-rotating register. */
01585 
01586           if (lr_info->num_names <= 1)
01587             continue;
01588 
01589           name_index = Lpipe_find_name (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info);
01590 
01591           ptype = oper->dest[j]->ptype;
01592           L_delete_operand (oper->dest[j]);
01593           oper->dest[j] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[name_index]);
01594           oper->dest[j]->ptype = ptype;
01595         }
01596 
01597       /* rename source operands */
01598       for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
01599         {
01600           if (!L_is_register (oper->src[j]))
01601             continue;
01602 
01603           /* loop invariants will not have Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
01604 
01605           if (!(mve_info = softpipe_info->src_mve_info[j]))
01606             continue;
01607 
01608           lr_info = mve_info->live_range;
01609 
01610           /* If set to 1, then no rotating regs were allocated
01611              for this variable and it can be allocated to a 
01612              non-rotating register. */
01613           if (lr_info->num_names <= 1)
01614             continue;
01615 
01616           /* Find the copy of the kernel that contains the reference
01617              definition for this lifetime.  If the lifetime is 
01618              positive, that copy is the current copy minus the
01619              number of stages that the lifetime spans.  If the
01620              variant is used before defined in a single copy of the
01621              kernel, go back 1 stage further.  Because some lifetimes
01622              are live across the backedge of the unrolled kernel,
01623              the resulting number may be negative.  stage_lifetime
01624              is guaranteed to be less than unroll, so add unroll 
01625              and then coupute the result modulo unroll.  */
01626 
01627           if (mve_info->lifetime < 0)
01628             L_punt ("Lpipe_rreg_transform (src): "
01629                     "not sure how we got here yet.");
01630 
01631           /* (op 39 add [(r 85 i)] [(r 85 i)(i 1)]
01632              <(stage (i 1))(iter (i 1))(isl (i 1998)(i 6)(i 1))>)
01633              This is defined in stage 1 (not 0) and will be written
01634              as r32 during that stage.  This instruction is read
01635              from the previous iteration writing of it, which 
01636              happened 2 cycles, which is one stage, which is the 
01637              same instruction in the previous iteration. So, that 
01638              value, is now in r33. r32 is in names [1] and 
01639              r33 is names[2]. */
01640 
01641           name_index = Lpipe_find_name (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info);
01642           
01643           L_delete_operand (oper->src[j]);
01644           oper->src[j] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[name_index]);
01645         }
01646 
01647       /* rename predicate operand */
01648 
01649       if (L_is_register (oper->pred[0]) &&
01650           (mve_info = softpipe_info->pred_mve_info[0]) &&
01651           (lr_info = mve_info->live_range) &&
01652           (lr_info->num_names > 1))
01653         {
01654           if (mve_info->lifetime < 0)
01655             L_punt ("Lpipe_rreg_transform (pred): negative lifetime.");
01656 
01657           name_index = Lpipe_find_name (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info);
01658 
01659           ptype = oper->pred[0]->ptype;
01660           L_delete_operand (oper->pred[0]);
01661           oper->pred[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[name_index]);
01662           oper->pred[0]->ptype = ptype;
01663         }
01664     }
01665 
01666   kernel_cb->flags =
01667     L_SET_BIT_FLAG (kernel_cb->flags, L_CB_ROT_REG_ALLOCATED);
01668 
01669   return 0;
01670 }
01671 
01672 
01673 static void
01674 Lpipe_gen_rot_pro_fixup (L_Func *fn, L_Cb *cb, Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info,
01675                          int reg)
01676 {
01677   L_Oper *new_oper;
01678   int opc;
01679 
01680   if (lr_info->num_names <= 1)
01681     return;
01682 
01683   /* if live range has been renamed, insert an instruction to move
01684      the value to the register expected outside the loop */
01685 
01686   opc = Lpipe_mov_opc (lr_info->rinfo->operand);
01687   new_oper = L_create_new_op (opc);
01688 
01689   /* From the prologue, the live in name can be matched.  reg
01690      in the live in context is the register number.  The original
01691      operand is copied to get the types correct. */
01692   new_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[0]);
01693   new_oper->dest[0]->value.r = reg;
01694   
01695   if (opc == Lop_PRED_COPY && M_arch == M_TAHOE)
01696     {
01697       new_oper->pred[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[0]);
01698       L_assign_ptype_null (new_oper->pred[0]);
01699     }
01700   else
01701     {
01702       new_oper->src[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[0]);
01703       L_assign_ptype_null (new_oper->src[0]);
01704     }
01705 
01706   L_assign_ptype_null (new_oper->dest[0]);
01707 
01708   L_insert_oper_before (cb, cb->first_op, new_oper);
01709   L_annotate_oper (fn, cb, new_oper);
01710   L_delete_oper (cb, new_oper);
01711 
01712   return;
01713 }
01714 
01715 
01716 /* Find variants that are live into the original loop body, and insert
01717    a move to copy the value defined before the loop to the name used
01718    inside the loop.  When the were prologue for rotating registers was
01719    created, the rotating register numbers for reads and writes are
01720    incremented by one for each stage of unroll to simulate the effects
01721    of a rotation at the end of each stage. So, the live in values are
01722    from an imaginary stage -1 (if stage 0 is the first of the
01723    prologue.  */
01724 
01725 void
01726 Lpipe_fix_live_in_rot (SM_Cb *sm_cb)
01727 {
01728   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
01729   L_Cb *kernel_cb, *prologue_cb;
01730   L_Oper *oper;
01731   SM_Oper *sm_op;
01732   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
01733   Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info;
01734   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
01735   int stage_count = sm_cb->stages, reg = 0, j;
01736 
01737   kernel_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb;
01738   prologue_cb = kernel_cb->prev_cb;
01739 
01740   for (sm_op = sm_cb->first_serial_op; sm_op; sm_op = sm_op->next_serial_op)
01741     {
01742       oper = sm_op->lcode_op;
01743       softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
01744 
01745       for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
01746         {
01747           if (!L_is_register (oper->dest[j]))
01748             continue;
01749 
01750           /* Exclude loop invariants */
01751           if (!(mve_info = softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j]))
01752             continue;
01753 
01754           lr_info = mve_info->live_range;
01755 
01756           if ((lr_info->num_names <= 1) ||
01757               !lr_info->live_in || 
01758               lr_info->prologue_mov_inserted)
01759             continue;
01760 
01761           /* Insert prologue move */
01762 
01763           if (Lpipe_schema == MULTI_EPI_ROT_REG)
01764             {
01765               /* Stages start numbering at 0.  stage_count-1 is the
01766                * number of prologue stages.  We need to account for
01767                * the number of missing shifts in the prologue between
01768                * the first read in its stage and the kernel.  Account
01769                * for the number of rotations simulated by shifts. The
01770                * kernel is in stage stage_count-1.  The current
01771                * instruction that sees the live in is in stage
01772                * softpipe_info->stage.  The difference is the number
01773                * of stage crossings. Since we are looking at the def,
01774                * we need to get the previous version of the register,
01775                * hence the +1. 
01776                */
01777                 
01778               int stg_ofst = (stage_count - 1) - softpipe_info->stage + 1;
01779               reg = Lpipe_get_pro_reg (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info, stg_ofst);
01780             }
01781           else if (Lpipe_schema == KERNEL_ONLY)
01782             {
01783               /* There are no simulated shifts by the prologue since
01784                * there is no prologue!  The kernel itself acts as the
01785                * prologue.  So, if read in stage 0, then write into x.
01786                * If read in stage 1, then write into x-1, to account
01787                * for the real shift into the register. Since we are
01788                * looking at the def, we need to get the previous
01789                * version of the register, hence the +1. 
01790                */
01791 
01792               reg = oper->dest[j]->value.r - (softpipe_info->stage - 1);
01793             }
01794           else
01795             {
01796               L_punt ("Lpipe_fix_live_in_rot: "
01797                       "Invalid codegen schema %d.", Lpipe_schema);
01798             }
01799 
01800           Lpipe_gen_rot_pro_fixup (fn, prologue_cb, lr_info, reg);
01801 
01802           lr_info->prologue_mov_inserted = 1;
01803         }
01804     }
01805 
01806   return;
01807 }
01808 
01809 
01810 static void
01811 Lpipe_gen_rot_epi_fixup (L_Func *fn, L_Cb *cb, Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info,
01812                          int name_index)
01813 {
01814   L_Oper *new_oper;
01815   int opc;
01816 
01817   if (lr_info->num_names <= 1)
01818     return;
01819 
01820   /* if live range has been renamed, insert an instruction to move
01821      the value to the register expected outside the loop */
01822 
01823   opc = Lpipe_mov_opc (lr_info->rinfo->operand);
01824   new_oper = L_create_new_op (opc);
01825 
01826   if (name_index >= lr_info->num_names)
01827     L_punt ("Lpipe_gen_rot_epi_fixup: requested name %d "
01828             "unavailable (name %d highest available)",
01829             name_index, (lr_info->num_names - 1));
01830 
01831   /* dest is the original name */
01832 
01833   new_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[0]);
01834 
01835   if (opc == Lop_PRED_COPY && M_arch == M_TAHOE)
01836     {
01837       new_oper->pred[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[name_index]);
01838       L_assign_ptype_null (new_oper->pred[0]);
01839     }
01840   else
01841     {
01842       /* The src of the move is the register number at the time of exit.
01843          names[0] is the original, names[1] is the def version, names[2] is
01844          after the first rotation, etc. */
01845       new_oper->src[0] = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[name_index]);
01846       L_assign_ptype_null (new_oper->src[0]);
01847     }
01848 
01849   L_assign_ptype_null (new_oper->dest[0]);
01850 
01851   /* make sure move goes before jump at end of epilogue */
01852   if (L_uncond_branch (cb->last_op))
01853     L_insert_oper_before (cb, cb->last_op, new_oper);
01854   else
01855     L_insert_oper_after (cb, cb->last_op, new_oper);
01856 
01857   L_annotate_oper (fn, cb, new_oper);
01858   L_delete_oper (cb, new_oper);
01859 
01860   return;
01861 }
01862 
01863 
01864 /* The live out fix ups for the loop_back branch for all exits
01865    are the same.  They are always unrotated from their positions
01866    in the last stage of the kernel.  For 1 epilogue, the output
01867    registers are rotated -1, for 2 epis, -2, etc. For
01868    0 epis, we must insert correction code just after the kernel.
01869    For 1 or more, we might be able to find some of the live out
01870    writes in the epilogue, where we can edit, but some might be
01871    from earlier stages executed from within the kernel.  So
01872    for simplicity, just put the correction code at the head of
01873    post-loop code. 
01874    
01875    The live out for all copies of a side-exit are also the same.
01876    Place the instructions at the head of the block after any
01877    epilogue blocks.
01878 
01879    Rewritten to use implicit src MVE info fields on loop exit opers.
01880    This fixes a host of problems. -- JWS 20030812
01881 */
01882 
01883 void
01884 Lpipe_fix_live_out_rot (SM_Cb * sm_cb, SM_Oper * sm_loop_back_br)
01885 {
01886   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
01887   L_Cb *kernel_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb, *epilogue_cb;
01888   SM_Oper *sm_exit_op;
01889   Softpipe_Op_Info *exit_softpipe_info;
01890   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
01891   Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info;
01892 
01893   /* There should always be an epilogue on the exit paths. There
01894      should be only one per each original loop exit. Place the
01895      compensation code at the end of each epilogue but before any
01896      branch. */
01897 
01898   for (sm_exit_op = sm_cb->first_serial_op;
01899        sm_exit_op; sm_exit_op = sm_exit_op->next_serial_op)
01900     {
01901       exit_softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (sm_exit_op->lcode_op);
01902 
01903       if (!exit_softpipe_info->exit_cb)
01904         continue;
01905 
01906       if (sm_exit_op == sm_loop_back_br)
01907         {
01908           epilogue_cb = kernel_cb->next_cb;
01909         }
01910       else
01911         {
01912           L_Flow *epilogue_flow;
01913 
01914           if (!(epilogue_flow = L_find_flow_for_branch (kernel_cb,
01915                                                         sm_exit_op->lcode_op)))
01916             L_punt ("Lpipe_fix_live_out_rot: unable to find epilogue flow");
01917 
01918           epilogue_cb = epilogue_flow->dst_cb;
01919         }
01920 
01921       List_start (exit_softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info);
01922       while ((mve_info = List_next (exit_softpipe_info->isrc_mve_info)))
01923         {
01924           int name_index;
01925 
01926           lr_info = mve_info->live_range;
01927 
01928           if (lr_info->num_names <= 1)
01929             continue;
01930 
01931           if (!L_in_cb_IN_set (exit_softpipe_info->exit_cb,
01932                                lr_info->rinfo->operand))
01933             continue;
01934 
01935           name_index = Lpipe_find_name (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info);
01936 
01937 #if 0
01938           /* This is already accounted for in setting of use lifetime
01939            * to life-to-loopback + 1 -- JWS */
01940 
01941           /* The IA64 br.?top instructions cause a loop rotation
01942            * even when the loop back fails.  So, there is an extra
01943            * shift from the exit to the prologue.  The extra name
01944            * was already accounted for when the last_access was
01945            * computed to be the cycle after the loop iteration
01946            * finished. -- MCM */
01947           if (sm_exit_op == sm_loop_back_br)
01948             name_index++;
01949 #endif
01950           Lpipe_gen_rot_epi_fixup (fn, epilogue_cb, lr_info, name_index);
01951         }
01952     }
01953   return;
01954 }
01955 
01956 
01957 /*************************************************************************
01958                 MVE Function Definitions
01959 *************************************************************************/
01960 
01961 /* unroll the kernel and rename the operands */
01962 void
01963 Lpipe_mve_transform (SM_Cb * sm_cb, int unroll)
01964 {
01965   int ii = sm_cb->II, stage_count = sm_cb->stages;
01966   L_Oper *oper, *new_oper;
01967   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info, *new_softpipe_info;
01968   int copy;                     /* current copy of kernel being made */
01969   int j;
01970   Lpipe_MVEInfo *src_mve_info;
01971   Lpipe_MVEInfo *dest_mve_info;
01972   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
01973   int stage_lifetime;           /* lifetime of variant in stages */
01974   int def_copy;                 /* copy of kernel in which variant is def */
01975   int def_stage;                /* intra-iter stage in which the variant is
01976                                    first defined */
01977   int name_index;               /* index into array of names for variant */
01978   L_Oper *temp_last_op;         /* temporary pointer to the last operation
01979                                    of the last completed copy of the kernel */
01980   L_Attr *attr;
01981   L_Cb *kernel_cb;
01982   L_Attr *isl_attr;
01983 
01984   /* global vars - arrays of pointers to the first and last oper of
01985      each copy of the kernel code in the unrolled loop.  Copies are
01986      numbered 0 to unroll-1 */
01987 
01988   if (!(kernel_copy_first_op = (L_Oper **) calloc (unroll, sizeof (L_Oper *))))
01989     L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_transform: malloc out of space\n");
01990 
01991   if (!(kernel_copy_last_op = (L_Oper **) calloc (unroll, sizeof (L_Oper *))))
01992     L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_transform: malloc out of space\n");
01993 
01994   kernel_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb;
01995 
01996   if (kernel_cb->first_op == NULL)
01997     L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_transform: Empty kernel.  cb %d", kernel_cb->id);
01998 
01999   /* copy 0 is the original one */
02000   kernel_copy_first_op[0] = kernel_cb->first_op;
02001   kernel_copy_last_op[0] = kernel_cb->last_op;
02002 
02003   /* temp pointer to the last oper of the last completed copy of the kernel */
02004   temp_last_op = kernel_cb->last_op;
02005 
02006   /* make unroll-1 more copies of kernel and rename all copies */
02007 
02008   for (copy = 0; copy < unroll; copy++)
02009     {
02010       for (oper = kernel_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
02011         {
02012           if (Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02013             continue;
02014 
02015           /* will break out of this loop after processing 
02016              kernel_copy_last_op[0] */
02017 
02018           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
02019 
02020           if (copy == 0)
02021             {
02022               /* First copy of kernel is already there.  Just set some
02023                  pointers so that we can pretend we just created it and
02024                  rename it. */
02025               new_oper = oper;
02026               new_softpipe_info = softpipe_info;
02027             }
02028           else
02029             {
02030               /* need to create all other copies */
02031               new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
02032               new_oper->ext =
02033                 (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
02034               new_softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
02035               if (!(attr = L_find_attr (new_oper->attr, "iter")))
02036                 L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_transform: oper has no iter attribute"
02037                         " - oper: %d\n", new_oper->id);
02038               L_set_int_attr_field (attr, 0, (copy + 1));
02039               L_insert_oper_after (kernel_cb, kernel_cb->last_op,
02040                                    new_oper);
02041             }
02042 
02043           /* Issue_time now becomes the final issue time within the
02044            * unrolled kernel.  The issue time within a single iteration
02045            * is still available as the intra_iter_issue_time. 
02046            */
02047 
02048           new_softpipe_info->issue_time = copy * ii +
02049             softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
02050 
02051           new_softpipe_info->kernel_copy = copy;
