02052           if ((isl_attr = L_find_attr (new_oper->attr, "isl")))
02053             L_set_int_attr_field (isl_attr, 0,
02054                                   isl_attr->field[0]->value.i +
02055                                   (ii * copy));
02056           else
02057             L_punt ("Lpipe_mve_transform: copied oper has no isl attribute");
02058 
02059           /* rename destination operands */
02060 
02061           for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
02062             {
02063               if (!L_is_register (new_oper->dest[j]))
02064                 continue;
02065 
02066               dest_mve_info = new_softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j];
02067               lr_info = dest_mve_info->live_range;
02068 
02069               if (oper == lr_info->def_sm_oper->lcode_op)
02070                 {
02071                   /* COPY OF REFERENCE DEFINITION: Versions of the
02072                    * variant are referred to using the kernel copy and
02073                    * intra-iteration stage (def_stage) in which that
02074                    * version is defined.  Copy x of the kernel uses
02075                    * version ((stage_count - def_stage + x) mod
02076                    * num_names) of the variant.  Using this
02077                    * convention, the first uses of live in variants
02078                    * always have the same name as outside the loop.
02079                    */
02080 
02081                   def_copy = copy;
02082                 }
02083               else
02084                 {
02085                   /* Need to rename to match the reference definition.
02086                    * Find the copy of the kernel that contains the
02087                    * reference definition. See renaming of source
02088                    * operands 
02089                    */
02090                   if (dest_mve_info->lifetime >= 0)
02091                     {
02092                       stage_lifetime = dest_mve_info->lifetime / ii;
02093                       if (dest_mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr)
02094                         stage_lifetime++;
02095                       def_copy =
02096                         (copy - stage_lifetime + unroll) % unroll;
02097                     }
02098                   else
02099                     {
02100                       stage_lifetime = -dest_mve_info->lifetime / ii;
02101                       if (dest_mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr)
02102                         stage_lifetime++;
02103                       def_copy = (copy + stage_lifetime) % unroll;
02104                     }
02105                 }
02106               def_stage = lr_info->first_def_time / ii;
02107               name_index = 
02108                 (stage_count - def_stage + def_copy) % lr_info->num_names;
02109               new_oper->dest[j]->value.r = lr_info->names[name_index]->value.r;
02110             }
02111 
02112           /* rename source operands */
02113 
02114           for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
02115             {
02116               /* loop invariants won't have Lpipe_MVEInfo structures */
02117               if (!L_is_register (new_oper->src[j]) ||
02118                   !(src_mve_info = new_softpipe_info->src_mve_info[j]))
02119                 continue;
02120 
02121               /* Find the copy of the kernel that contains the
02122                * reference definition for this lifetime.  If the
02123                * lifetime is positive, that copy is the current copy
02124                * minus the number of stages that the lifetime spans.
02125                * If the variant is used before defined in a single
02126                * copy of the kernel, go back 1 stage further.  Because
02127                * some lifetimes are live across the backedge of the
02128                * unrolled kernel, the resulting number may be
02129                * negative.  stage_lifetime is guaranteed to be less
02130                * than unroll, so add unroll and then coupute the
02131                * result modulo unroll.  */
02132 
02133               if (src_mve_info->lifetime >= 0)
02134                 {
02135                   stage_lifetime = src_mve_info->lifetime / ii;
02136                   if (src_mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr)
02137                     stage_lifetime++;
02138                   def_copy = (copy + unroll - stage_lifetime) % unroll;
02139                 }
02140               else
02141                 {
02142                   stage_lifetime = (-src_mve_info->lifetime) / ii;
02143                   if (src_mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr)
02144                     stage_lifetime++;
02145                   def_copy = (copy + stage_lifetime) % unroll;
02146                 }
02147               lr_info = src_mve_info->live_range;
02148               def_stage = lr_info->first_def_time / ii;
02149               name_index =
02150                 (stage_count - def_stage + def_copy) % lr_info->num_names;
02151               new_oper->src[j]->value.r = lr_info->names[name_index]->value.r;
02152             }
02153 
02154           /* rename pred[0] operands */
02155 
02156           if (L_is_register (new_oper->pred[0]) &&
02157               (src_mve_info = new_softpipe_info->pred_mve_info[0]))
02158             {
02159               /* Find the copy of the kernel in which this lifetime
02160                * was defined.  That copy is the current copy minus the
02161                * number of stages that the lifetime spans.  If the
02162                * variant is used before defined in a single copy of
02163                * the kernel, go back 1 stage further.  Because some
02164                * lifetimes are live across the backedge of the
02165                * unrolled kernel, the resulting number may be
02166                * negative.  stage_lifetime is guaranteed to be less
02167                * than unroll, so add unroll and then compute the
02168                * resulting modulo unroll. */
02169               if (src_mve_info->lifetime >= 0)
02170                 {
02171                   stage_lifetime = src_mve_info->lifetime / ii;
02172                   if (src_mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr)
02173                     stage_lifetime++;
02174                   def_copy = (copy + unroll - stage_lifetime) % unroll;
02175                 }
02176               else
02177                 {
02178                   stage_lifetime = (-src_mve_info->lifetime) / ii;
02179                   if (src_mve_info->stage_lifetime_incr)
02180                     stage_lifetime++;
02181                   def_copy = (copy + stage_lifetime) % unroll;
02182                 }
02183               
02184               lr_info = src_mve_info->live_range;
02185               def_stage = lr_info->first_def_time / ii;
02186               name_index =
02187                 (stage_count - def_stage + def_copy) % lr_info->num_names;
02188               new_oper->pred[0]->value.r = lr_info->names[name_index]->value.r;
02189             }
02190           if (oper == kernel_copy_last_op[0])
02191             break;
02192         }
02193 
02194       /* First oper of copies 1 to unroll-1 of the kernel is the oper
02195          after the last oper of the previous copy of the kernel.  The
02196          last oper of this copy of the kernel is the last operation in
02197          the cb. */
02198 
02199       if (copy != 0)
02200         {
02201           kernel_copy_first_op[copy] = temp_last_op->next_op;
02202           kernel_copy_last_op[copy] = kernel_cb->last_op;
02203           temp_last_op = kernel_cb->last_op;
02204         }
02205     }
02206   return;
02207 }
02208 
02209 
02210 /* Find variants that are live into the original loop body, and insert
02211    a move to copy the value defined before the loop to the name used
02212    inside the loop after MVE. */
02213 void
02214 Lpipe_fix_live_in (SM_Cb * sm_cb)
02215 {
02216 #if 1
02217   L_punt ("Lpipe_fix_live_in: UNSUPPORTED");
02218 #else
02219   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
02220   L_Cb *kernel_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb, *prologue_cb = kernel_cb->prev_cb;
02221   L_Oper *oper, *new_oper, *first_op, *last_op;
02222   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
02223   Lpipe_MVEInfo *src_mve_info;
02224   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
02225   int j, stage_count = sm_cb->stages;
02226 
02227   /* find live in variables */
02228 
02229   /* AARGH! Can't do this!!! Accurate dataflow has been lost! */
02230   L_do_flow_analysis (fn, LIVE_VARIABLE);
02231 
02232   /* Check source operands in prologue to find live in loop variants. */
02233 
02234   for (oper = prologue_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
02235     {
02236       if (Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02237         continue;
02238 
02239       /* for remainder loop schema, some opers in prologue do not have
02240          Softpipe_Op_Info structures */
02241       if (!(softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper)))
02242         continue;
02243 
02244       for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
02245         {
02246           if (!L_is_register (oper->src[j]))
02247             continue;
02248 
02249           /* exclude loop invariants */
02250           if (!(src_mve_info = softpipe_info->src_mve_info[j]))
02251             continue;
02252 
02253           lr_info = src_mve_info->live_range;
02254               
02255           /* if variant is live in, and its current name is not the
02256              same as the one in the orig loop body, insert a move */
02257           if (L_in_cb_IN_set (prologue_cb, oper->src[j]) &&
02258               (!L_same_operand (oper->src[j], lr_info->names[0])) &&
02259               (!lr_info->prologue_mov_inserted))
02260             {
02261               L_punt
02262                 ("Lpipe_fix_live_in: Should not need to fix live in.  "
02263                  "Function %s, cb = %d, oper = %d\n", fn->name,
02264                  prologue_cb->id, oper->id);
02265 
02266               new_oper =
02267                 Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (L_copy_operand
02268                                                   (oper->src[j]),
02269                                                   L_copy_operand
02270                                                   (lr_info->names
02271                                                    [0]));
02272               L_insert_oper_before (prologue_cb,
02273                                     prologue_cb->first_op, new_oper);
02274               lr_info->prologue_mov_inserted = 1;
02275             }
02276         }
02277     }
02278 
02279   /* Check source operands in last stage of first iteration.  This is
02280      in the first copy of the kernel */
02281 
02282   first_op = kernel_copy_first_op[0];
02283   last_op = kernel_copy_last_op[0];
02284 
02285   for (oper = first_op; oper; oper = (oper!=last_op) ? oper->next_op : NULL)
02286     {
02287       if (Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02288         continue;
02289 
02290       /* Only need to look at first copy of kernel.  Will break out of 
02291          this loop after kernel_copy_last_op[0] */
02292 
02293       softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
02294       /* only look at last stage of first iteration */
02295       if (softpipe_info->stage != (stage_count - 1))
02296         continue;
02297 
02298       for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
02299         {
02300           if (!L_is_register (oper->src[j]))
02301             continue;
02302 
02303           /* exclude loop invariants */
02304           if (!(src_mve_info = softpipe_info->src_mve_info[j]))
02305             continue;
02306 
02307           lr_info = src_mve_info->live_range;
02308               
02309           /* if variant is live in to the prologue and 
02310              its current name is not the same as the 
02311              one in the original loop body, and a move has not
02312              already been inserted for this variant, 
02313              insert a move */
02314           if (!L_in_cb_IN_set (prologue_cb, oper->src[j]))
02315             continue;
02316 
02317           if (lr_info->prologue_mov_inserted)     
02318             continue;
02319 
02320           if (L_same_operand (oper->src[j], lr_info->names[0]))
02321             continue;
02322 
02323           L_punt ("Lpipe_fix_live_in: "
02324                   "Should not need to fix live in.  "
02325                   "Function %s, cb = %d, oper = %d\n",
02326                   fn->name, kernel_cb->id, oper->id);
02327               
02328           new_oper =
02329             Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (L_copy_operand (oper->src[j]),
02330                                        L_copy_operand (lr_info->names [0]));
02331           L_insert_oper_before (prologue_cb, prologue_cb->first_op, new_oper);
02332           lr_info->prologue_mov_inserted = 1;
02333         }
02334     }
02335 #endif
02336   return;
02337 }
02338 
02339 
02340 static void
02341 Lpipe_merge_compensation_code (L_Cb * epilogue_cb)
02342 {
02343   L_Oper *last_oper, *oper, *new_oper;
02344   L_Cb *ssa_cb;
02345 
02346   last_oper = epilogue_cb->last_op;
02347   if (L_uncond_branch (last_oper))
02348     {
02349       ssa_cb = L_find_branch_dest (last_oper);
02350       if (L_find_attr (ssa_cb->attr, "ssa_comp_code"))
02351         {
02352           for (oper = ssa_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
02353             {
02354               if (!L_general_move_opcode (oper))
02355                 continue;
02356               new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
02357               L_insert_oper_before (epilogue_cb, last_oper, new_oper);
02358             }
02359         }
02360     }
02361   return;
02362 }
02363 
02364 
02365 /* fix up live out for a single epilogue */
02366 static void
02367 Lpipe_fix_live_out_epi (L_Cb * kernel_cb, L_Oper * exit_branch)
02368 {
02369   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info, *exit_branch_info;
02370   int epi_stage, theta, j;
02371   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
02372   L_Oper *oper, *new_oper;
02373   L_Operand *dest, *original_name;
02374   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
02375 
02376   if (!L_cond_branch (exit_branch))
02377     L_punt ("Lpipe_fix_live_out_epi: Called on non-cond branch");
02378 
02379   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
02380   theta = exit_branch_info->stage;
02381 
02382   epilogue_cb = (exit_branch == kernel_cb->last_op) ?
02383     kernel_cb->next_cb : L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
02384 
02385   /* Check destination operands in last two iterations in epilogue to find 
02386      live out loop variants.  For now assume no EVRs. */
02387 
02388   for (oper = epilogue_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
02389     {
02390       if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02391         {
02392           /* some opers in epilogue (such as the jump) do not have 
02393              Softpipe_Op_Info structures */
02394           if (!(softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper)))
02395             continue;
02396 
02397           epi_stage = softpipe_info->epilogue_stage;
02398 
02399           /* Only look at oper if it is from the last iteration or if it is
02400              from the 2nd to last iteration and is from a later home block 
02401              than the exit branch.  During epilogue stage x, the last
02402              iteration is in pipeline stage (x + theta), etc.  */
02403 
02404           if ((softpipe_info->stage == (epi_stage + theta)) ||
02405               ((softpipe_info->stage == (epi_stage + theta + 1)) &&
02406                (softpipe_info->home_block > exit_branch_info->home_block)))
02407             {
02408               for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
02409                 {
02410                   if (!(dest = oper->dest[j]) || !L_is_register (dest))
02411                     continue;
02412 
02413                   /* predicate for compare for reversed branch may not have
02414                      Lpipe_MVEInfo structure */
02415                   if (!softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j])
02416                     continue;
02417 
02418                   lr_info = softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j]->live_range;
02419 
02420                   /* quick check to see if live out of any branch in loop */
02421                   if (!lr_info->live_out)
02422                     continue;
02423 
02424                   /* exit branches from kernel have all been changed,
02425                      so must check live in of exit cb rather than live
02426                      out of branch */
02427                   original_name = lr_info->names[0];
02428                   if (!L_in_cb_IN_set
02429                       (exit_branch_info->exit_cb, original_name))
02430                     continue;
02431 
02432                   /* if live range has been renamed, insert an inst to move
02433                      the value to the register expected outside the loop */
02434                   if (!L_same_operand (dest, original_name))
02435                     {
02436                       new_oper =
02437                         Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (L_copy_operand
02438                                                           (original_name),
02439                                                           L_copy_operand
02440                                                           (dest));
02441                       /* make sure move goes before jump at end of epilogue */
02442                       if (L_uncond_branch (epilogue_cb->last_op))
02443                         L_insert_oper_before (epilogue_cb,
02444                                               epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02445                       else
02446                         L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb,
02447                                              epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02448                     }
02449                 }
02450             }
02451         }
02452     }
02453   return;
02454 }
02455 
02456 
02457 /* fix up live out for a single epilogue */
02458 static Set
02459 Lpipe_fix_set_out_epi (Set to_fix, L_Cb * kernel_cb, L_Oper * exit_branch)
02460 {
02461   L_Oper *oper, *new_oper;
02462   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info, *exit_branch_info;
02463   int epi_stage, j, theta;
02464   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
02465   L_Operand *dest, *original_name;
02466   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
02467 
02468   if (!L_cond_branch (exit_branch))
02469     L_punt ("Lpipe_fix_live_out_epi: Called on non-cond branch");
02470 
02471   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
02472   theta = exit_branch_info->stage;
02473   if (exit_branch == kernel_cb->last_op)
02474     epilogue_cb = kernel_cb->next_cb;
02475   else
02476     epilogue_cb = L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
02477 
02478   /* Check destination operands in last two iterations in epilogue to find 
02479      live out loop variants.  For now assume no EVRs. */
02480 
02481   for (oper = epilogue_cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
02482     {
02483       if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02484         {
02485           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
02486 
02487           /* some opers in epilogue (such as the jump) do not have 
02488              Softpipe_Op_Info structures */
02489           if (softpipe_info == NULL)
02490             continue;
02491 
02492           epi_stage = softpipe_info->epilogue_stage;
02493 
02494           /* Only look at oper if it is from the last iteration or if
02495              it is from the 2nd to last iteration and is from a later
02496              home block than the exit branch.  During epilogue stage
02497              x, the last iteration is in pipeline stage (x + theta),
02498              etc.  */
02499 
02500           if ((softpipe_info->stage == (epi_stage + theta)) ||
02501               ((softpipe_info->stage == (epi_stage + theta + 1)) &&
02502                (softpipe_info->home_block > exit_branch_info->home_block)))
02503             {
02504               for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
02505                 {
02506                   dest = oper->dest[j];
02507                   if (!L_is_register (dest))
02508                     continue;
02509 
02510                   /* predicate for compare for reversed branch may not have
02511                      Lpipe_MVEInfo structure */
02512                   if (!softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j])
02513                     continue;
02514 
02515                   lr_info = softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j]->live_range;
02516 
02517                   /* quick check to see if live out of any branch in loop */
02518                   if (!lr_info->live_out)
02519                     continue;
02520 
02521                   /* exit branches from kernel have all been changed, so must
02522                      check live in of exit cb rather than live out of branch */
02523                   original_name = lr_info->names[0];
02524 
02525                   if (!Set_in (to_fix, L_REG_MAC_INDEX (original_name)))
02526                     continue;
02527 
02528                   /* if live range has been renamed, insert an inst to move
02529                      the value to the register expected outside the loop */
02530                   if (!L_same_operand (dest, original_name))
02531                     {
02532                       new_oper =
02533                         Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (L_copy_operand
02534                                                           (original_name),
02535                                                           L_copy_operand
02536                                                           (dest));
02537                       /* make sure move goes before jump at end of epilogue */
02538                       if (L_uncond_branch (epilogue_cb->last_op))
02539                         L_insert_oper_before (epilogue_cb,
02540                                               epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02541                       else
02542                         L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb,
02543                                              epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02544                     }
02545 
02546                   to_fix =
02547                     Set_delete (to_fix, L_REG_MAC_INDEX (original_name));
02548                 }
02549             }
02550         }
02551     }
02552   return to_fix;
02553 }
02554 
02555 
02556 /* Fix up live out for the operations in iteration stage "stage" in
02557    the kernel copy defined by first and last op.  This is for the opers
02558    of the last iteration that do not appear in the epilogue.  Also
02559    check the 2nd to last iteration because of exits from the middle of
02560    the original loop body. */
02561 static void
02562 Lpipe_fix_live_out_stage (L_Cb * kernel_cb, L_Oper * exit_branch,
02563                           L_Oper * first_op, L_Oper * last_op, int stage)
02564 {
02565   L_Oper *oper;
02566   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
02567   Softpipe_Op_Info *exit_branch_info;
02568   int j;
02569   L_Operand *dest;
02570   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
02571   L_Oper *new_oper;
02572   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
02573   L_Operand *original_name;
02574 
02575   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
02576   if (exit_branch == kernel_cb->last_op)
02577     epilogue_cb = kernel_cb->next_cb;
02578   else
02579     epilogue_cb = L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
02580 
02581   for (oper = first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
02582     {
02583       if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02584         {
02585           /* Will break out of this loop after last_op */
02586 
02587           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
02588 
02589           /* Only look at oper if its from the last iteration and is _not_
02590              from a later home block than the exit branch or if it is
02591              from the 2nd to last iteration and _is_ from a later 
02592              home block thanthe exit branch.  The last iteration is 
02593              executing pipeline stage "stage" and the 2nd to last iteration
02594              is executing pipeline stage stage+1.  If stage is -1, want to
02595              check the first stage of the 2nd to last iteration. */
02596 
02597           if (((stage != -1) &&
02598                (softpipe_info->stage == stage) &&
02599                (softpipe_info->home_block <= exit_branch_info->home_block)) ||
02600               ((softpipe_info->stage == stage + 1) &&
02601                (softpipe_info->home_block > exit_branch_info->home_block)))
02602             {
02603               for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
02604                 {
02605                   dest = oper->dest[j];
02606                   if (!L_is_register (dest))
02607                     continue;
02608 
02609                   /* predicate for compare for reversed branch may not have
02610                      Lpipe_MVEInfo structure */
02611                   if (!softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j])
02612                     continue;
02613 
02614                   lr_info = softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j]->live_range;
02615 
02616                   /* quick check to see if live out of any branch in loop */
02617                   if (!lr_info->live_out)
02618                     continue;
02619 
02620                   /* exit branches from kernel have all been changed, so must
02621                      check live in of exit cb rather than live out of branch */
02622                   original_name = lr_info->names[0];
02623                   if (!L_in_cb_IN_set
02624                       (exit_branch_info->exit_cb, original_name))
02625                     continue;
02626 
02627                   /* if live range has been renamed, insert an inst to move
02628                      the value to the register expected outside the loop */
02629 
02630                   if (dest->value.r != original_name->value.r)
02631                     {
02632                       new_oper =
02633                         Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (L_copy_operand
02634                                                           (original_name),
02635                                                           L_copy_operand
02636                                                           (dest));
02637                       /* make sure move goes before jump at end of epilogue */
02638                       if (L_uncond_branch (epilogue_cb->last_op))
02639                         L_insert_oper_before (epilogue_cb,
02640                                               epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02641                       else
02642                         L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb,
02643                                              epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02644                     }
02645                 }
02646             }
02647 
02648           if (oper == last_op)
02649             break;
02650         }
02651     }
02652 }
02653 
02654 
02655 /* Fix up live out for the operations in iteration stage "stage" in
02656    the kernel copy defined by first and last op.  This is for the opers
02657    of the last iteration that do not appear in the epilogue.  Also
02658    check the 2nd to last iteration because of exits from the middle of
02659    the original loop body. */
02660 static Set
02661 Lpipe_fix_set_out_stage (Set to_fix, L_Cb * kernel_cb, L_Oper * exit_branch,
02662                          L_Oper * first_op, L_Oper * last_op, 
02663                          int stage)
02664 {
02665   L_Oper *oper, *new_oper;
02666   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info, *exit_branch_info;
02667   Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
02668   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
02669   L_Operand *dest, *original_name;
02670   int j;
02671 
02672   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
02673   if (exit_branch == kernel_cb->last_op)
02674     epilogue_cb = kernel_cb->next_cb;
02675   else
02676     epilogue_cb = L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
02677 
02678   for (oper = last_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->prev_op)
02679     {
02680       if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02681         {
02682           /* Will break out of this loop after last_op */
02683 
02684           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
02685 
02686           /* Only look at oper if it is from the last iteration and is 
02687              _not_ from a later home block than the exit branch or if it is
02688              from the 2nd to last iteration and _is_ from a later home block
02689              than the exit branch.  The last iteration is is executing
02690              pipeline stage "stage" and the 2nd to last iteration is executing
02691              pipeline stage stage+1.  If stage is -1, want to check the
02692              first stage of the 2nd to last iteration. */
02693 
02694           if (((stage != -1) &&
02695                (softpipe_info->stage == stage) &&
02696                (softpipe_info->home_block <= exit_branch_info->home_block)) ||
02697               ((softpipe_info->stage == stage + 1) &&
02698                (softpipe_info->home_block > exit_branch_info->home_block)))
02699             {
02700               for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
02701                 {
02702                   dest = oper->dest[j];
02703                   if (!L_is_register (dest))
02704                     continue;
02705 
02706                   /* predicate for compare for reversed branch may not have
02707                      Lpipe_MVEInfo structure */
02708                   if (!softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j])
02709                     continue;
02710 
02711                   lr_info = softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j]->live_range;
02712 
02713                   /* quick check to see if live out of any branch in loop */
02714                   if (!lr_info->live_out)
02715                     continue;
02716 
02717                   /* exit branches from kernel have all been changed, so must
02718                      check live in of exit cb rather than live out of branch */
02719                   original_name = lr_info->names[0];
02720 
02721                   if (!Set_in (to_fix, L_REG_MAC_INDEX (original_name)))
02722                     continue;
02723 
02724                   /* if live range has been renamed, insert an inst to move
02725                      the value to the register expected outside the loop */
02726 
02727                   if (dest->value.r != original_name->value.r)
02728                     {
02729                       new_oper =
02730                         Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (L_copy_operand
02731                                                           (original_name),
02732                                                           L_copy_operand
02733                                                           (dest));
02734                       /* make sure move goes before jump at end of epilogue */
02735                       if (L_uncond_branch (epilogue_cb->last_op))
02736                         L_insert_oper_before (epilogue_cb,
02737                                               epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02738                       else
02739                         L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb,
02740                                              epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
02741 
02742                       L_annotate_oper (L_fn, epilogue_cb, new_oper);
02743                       L_delete_oper (epilogue_cb, new_oper);
02744                     }
02745 
02746                   to_fix =
02747                     Set_delete (to_fix, L_REG_MAC_INDEX (original_name));
02748                 }
02749             }
02750 
02751           if (oper == first_op)
02752             break;
02753         }
02754     }
02755 
02756   return to_fix;
02757 }
02758 
02759 
02760 /* Move any variable live out from the last iteration to register
02761    expected outside loop if it is not already there.  If branch was in
02762    the middle of the original loop body, need to go back into the 2nd
02763    to last iteration as well. */
02764 void
02765 Lpipe_fix_live_out (SM_Cb * sm_cb, int unroll)
02766 {
02767   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
02768   L_Oper *oper, *first_op, *last_op;
02769   L_Cb *kernel_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb, *prologue_cb;
02770 
02771   prologue_cb = kernel_cb->prev_cb;
02772 
02773   if (Lpipe_schema == REM_LOOP)
02774     {
02775       Lpipe_fix_live_out_epi (kernel_cb, kernel_cb->last_op);
02776       /* Look at first stage of last iteration.  This is in the kernel. */
02777       first_op = kernel_copy_first_op[unroll - 1];
02778       last_op = kernel_copy_last_op[unroll - 1];
02779       Lpipe_fix_live_out_stage (kernel_cb, kernel_cb->last_op, first_op,
02780                                 last_op, 0);
02781     }
02782   else
02783     {                           /* MULTI_EPI */
02784       Set to_fix;
02785       int copy, stage, theta;
02786 
02787       /* for multiple epilogues, need to fix live out for each exit to an
02788          epilogue in the prologue and kernel */
02789 
02790       for (oper = prologue_cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
02791         {
02792           if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02793             {
02794               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
02795               if (L_cond_branch (oper))
02796                 {
02797                   /* if epilogue for last branch in prologue is the same as
02798                      for last branch in kernel only fix the live out once when
02799                      looking at the branch in the kernel */
02800                   if (oper == prologue_cb->last_op
02801                       && softpipe_info->loop_back_br)
02802                     continue;
02803 
02804                   to_fix =
02805                     Set_copy (L_get_cb_IN_set (softpipe_info->exit_cb));
02806 
02807                   /* check the tail of the last 2 iterations */
02808                   to_fix =
02809                     Lpipe_fix_set_out_epi (to_fix, kernel_cb, oper);
02810                   /* Check live out from head of the last two
02811                      iterations.  Because the prologue is copied from
02812                      the kernel, examine the appropriate copy of the
02813                      kernel instead of the prologue itself.  This is
02814                      done because there are convenient pointers to
02815                      each copy of the kernel, but not for each stage
02816                      of the prologue.  The second to the last
02817                      iteration is examined even if the exit branch
02818                      corresponds to the first iteration of the loop.
02819                      The renaming and handling of live in is such that
02820                      the correct value will be found by pretending
02821                      there is an iteration before the first one. */
02822 
02823                   copy = softpipe_info->kernel_copy;
02824                   theta = softpipe_info->stage;
02825                   for (stage = theta; stage >= -1; stage--)
02826                     {
02827                       first_op = kernel_copy_first_op[copy];
02828                       last_op = (stage == theta) ? oper :
02829                         kernel_copy_last_op[copy];
02830 
02831                       to_fix =
02832                         Lpipe_fix_set_out_stage (to_fix, kernel_cb, oper,
02833                                                  first_op, last_op, stage);
02834                       copy = Lpipe_modulo_decrement (copy, unroll);
02835                     }
02836 
02837                   to_fix = Set_dispose (to_fix);
02838                   Lpipe_merge_compensation_code (L_find_branch_dest (oper));
02839                 }
02840             }
02841         }
02842 
02843       for (oper = kernel_cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
02844         {
02845           if (L_cond_branch (oper))
02846             {
02847               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
02848               to_fix = Set_copy (L_get_cb_IN_set (softpipe_info->exit_cb));
02849               /* check the tail of the last 2 iterations */
02850               to_fix = Lpipe_fix_set_out_epi (to_fix, kernel_cb, oper);
02851 
02852               /* Check live out from head of the last 2
02853                  iterations. */
02854               copy = softpipe_info->kernel_copy;
02855               theta = softpipe_info->stage;
02856 
02857               /* if stage = -1, really only checking stage 0 of the 2nd to
02858                  last iteration */
02859               for (stage = theta; stage >= -1; stage--)
02860                 {
02861                   first_op = kernel_copy_first_op[copy];
02862                   last_op = (stage == theta) ? oper : 
02863                     kernel_copy_last_op[copy];
02864 
02865                   to_fix = Lpipe_fix_set_out_stage (to_fix, kernel_cb, oper,
02866                                                     first_op, last_op, stage);
02867                   copy = Lpipe_modulo_decrement (copy, unroll);
02868                 }
02869 
02870               to_fix = Set_dispose (to_fix);
02871               if (oper != kernel_cb->last_op)
02872                 Lpipe_merge_compensation_code (L_find_branch_dest (oper));
02873               to_fix = Set_dispose (to_fix);
02874             }
02875         }
02876     }
02877   return;
02878 }
02879 
02880 
02881 int
02882 Lpipe_get_pro_reg (SM_Cb *sm_cb, Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info, 
02883                    Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info, int stg_ofst)
02884 {
02885   L_Operand *opd;
02886   int nam_idx = Lpipe_find_name (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info) + stg_ofst;
02887 
02888   if (nam_idx >= lr_info->num_names_w_pro)
02889     L_punt ("Lpipe_get_pro_reg: in fn %s cb %d: %d > %d --- "
02890             "too many prologue names",
02891             sm_cb->lcode_fn->name, sm_cb->lcode_cb->id, 
02892             nam_idx, lr_info->num_names_w_pro);
02893 
02894   if (!(opd = lr_info->names[nam_idx]))
02895     {
02896       opd = L_copy_operand (lr_info->names[0]);
02897       opd->value.r = ++ sm_cb->lcode_fn->max_reg_id;
02898       lr_info->names[nam_idx] = opd;
02899     }
02900 
02901   return opd->value.r;
02902 }
